qas.question: What controversial technology did the US use in Pakistan?
Which US agency runs its drones in Pakistan?
Why did the US use the CIA instead of the Air Force to run drones?

answers.text: to avoid breaching sovereignty through military invasion

qas.question: Abuse of what term allowed a lack of a formal war declaration?
What does the US Government use the Air Force for?
What did the United States criticize?
What does the Pakistan use for airstrikes?
What term was Pakistan accused of abusing?
The term Global War on Terror required formally doing what?

context: The use of <a0_0>drones<a0_0/> by <a1_0>the Central Intelligence Agency<a1_0/> in Pakistan to carry out operations associated with the Global War on Terror sparks debate over sovereignty and the laws of war. The U.S. Government uses <b6_0>the CIA<b6_0/> rather than the U.S. Air Force for <b4_0>strikes in Pakistan<b4_0/> in order <a2_0>to avoid breaching sovereignty through military invasion<a2_0/>. The United States was criticized by[according to whom?] a report on <b5_0>drone warfare and aerial sovereignty<b5_0/> for abusing the term '<a3_0><b7_0>Global War on Terror<b7_0/><a3_0/>' to carry out military operations through government agencies without formally <b8_0>declaring war<b8_0/>.
